name: "LOS ANGELES" Serigraph by Alex DEFER Kizu
description:
A founding member of the respected crews K2S & STN, Alex “DEFER” Kizu has been an integral part of the Los Angeles street art scene since the mid-80′s. Adept at working in various mediums such as markers, spray paint, acrylic, gouache, etc., Kizu expertly renders the beautifully complex letter-forms for which he is known.

A testament to Alex Kizu’s artistic stature in the realm of Los Angeles street art is that his interviews and work have been included in 3 esteemed compendiums of graffiti art: "The History Of Los Angeles Graffiti Vol. 1" by Robert Alva and Robert Reiling, "Graffiti LA” by Steve Grody, and the recently released, “The History of American Graffiti” by Roger Gastman (co-curator of MOCA's "Art In The Streets" exhibit) and Caleb Neelon.

This is Alex Kizu's first fine art print.

SERIGRAPH DETAILS
*”LOS ANGELES” by Alex “DEFER” Kizu
* 28″ x 36″
* Coventry Rag 320 GSM
* 5-color
* Hand-pulled screenprint
* Hand-deckled edges
* Edition of 80
* Signed & Numbered by the artist
* Certificate of Authenticity
* Printed by Modern Multiples
* Co-published by Alex “DEFER” Kizu and MORELWORKS Fine Art Publishing
* $200 USD

US Orders Shipped Via UPS
INTERNATIONAL Orders Shipped Via USPS/EMS
Please Allow 2-3 Weeks For Delivery

name: "ART SAVES LIVES" T-Shirt from Rage Against The Machine artist "The Phantom"
description:
A while back we printed a few promotional tees celebrating the release of our ART SAVES LIVES serigraph, the first-ever fine art print from The Phantom Street Artist, designer of Rage Against The Machine's album cover "The Battle Of Los Angeles" and featured artist in the TASCHEN book by the Wooster Collective, "Trespass. A History Of Uncommissioned Urban Art". The response was so enthusiastic, we decided to make the shirts available to the general public.

To make the tee, we extracted the image from the wall, inverted the colors and silk-screened the image on 100% cotton fabric. An iconic artistic-style coupled with a timeless message, our ART SAVES LIVES tee is the business.

*SIZING INFO*
Body Width: 
S=18"
M =20"
L =22"
XL=24"

Printed on 100% ringspun cotton tubular tee.

US Orders Shipped Via USPS
INTERNATIONAL Orders Shipped Via USPS/EMS

*NOTE: Please allow 1-2 weeks to ship*

name: "ART SAVES LIVES" Serigraph by THE PHANTOM STREET ARTIST
description:
Long sold-out, we've released the final 3 serigraphs (#2, #3 & #4) from this limited run of 75.

The Phantom Street Artist--the album cover artist responsible for Rage Against The Machine's "The Battle Of Los Angeles" and featured in The Wooster Collective's TASCHEN book, "Trespass. A History Of Uncommissioned Urban Art"--has joined forces with MORELWORKS Fine Art Publishing to produce his first-ever fine art print.

Utilizing a picture taken in 1993 of THE PHANTOM's seminal piece "ART SAVES LIVES", MORELWORKS worked with Master Printer Richard Duardo and his staff at Modern Multiples (the same studio that has printed for BANKSY, Shepard Fairey, D*Face, Ron English, among others) to create the definitive reproduction of an early Los Angeles street art masterpiece.

SERIGRAPH DETAILS
* 19.25" x 27.25"
* Stonehenge 250gm/wt
* 2-color
* Hand-pulled screenprint
* Hand-deckled edges
* Edition of 75
* Signed & numbered by the artist
* Certificate of Authenticity
* Printed by Modern Multiples

PUBLISHER'S PROOF'S NOW AVAILABLE FOR $1,850!

US Orders Shipped Via UPS
INTERNATIONAL Orders Shipped Via USPS/EMS
Please Allow 2-3 Weeks For Delivery
